SEARCH
Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.mapping

Interface ReadingMapper<M extends ReadingMapper<M,B>,B>

Type Parameters:
M - the concrete type of the mapper extending this interface, enabling fluent method chaining
B - the base interface type of objects that this mapper can bind to and serialize
All Superinterfaces:
Mapper
All Known Subinterfaces:
JSONMapper, XMLElementMapper, XMLMapper
All Known Implementing Classes:
JSONMapperImpl, XMLElementMapperImpl, XMLMapperImpl
public interface ReadingMapper<M extends ReadingMapper<M,B>,B> extends Mapper
A generic interface for mapping objects of type B to their serialized representations. This mapper facilitates the registration and management of custom TypeHandlers, enabling flexible and extensible serialization logic.

  • Method Details

    • getReadingInvoker

      @NotNull @NotNull ReadingInvoker getReadingInvoker()
      Retrieves the ReadingInvoker responsible for reading fields during serialization.
      Returns:
      a non-null ReadingInvoker instance

    • withTypeHandler

      @NotNull <T> M withTypeHandler(@NotNull @NotNull Class<T> type, @NotNull @NotNull TypeHandler<? super T> typeHandler)
      Registers a custom TypeHandler for the specified type.

      This method allows defining how instances of a particular type should be serialized. Handlers registered using this method take precedence over default handlers.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type for which the handler is being registered
      Parameters:
      type - the Class object representing the type to register the handler for
      typeHandler - the TypeHandler that defines the serialization logic for the specified type
      Returns:
      the current instance of M to allow method chaining
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either type or typeHandler is null

    • withTypeHandlers

      @NotNull M withTypeHandlers(@NotNull @NotNull Map<Class<?>,TypeHandler<?>> handlers)
      Registers multiple TypeHandlers at once.

      This method allows bulk registration of handlers for various types. Handlers registered using this method take precedence over default handlers.

      Parameters:
      handlers - a Map where keys are Class objects representing the types and values are their corresponding TypeHandlers
      Returns:
      the current instance of M to allow method chaining
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if typeHandlers is null or contains null keys/values

    • clearTypeHandlers

      @NotNull M clearTypeHandlers()
      Clears all registered TypeHandlers.

      This method removes all custom type handlers that have been registered, reverting to the default serialization behavior.

      Returns:
      the current instance of M to allow method chaining

    • bindTo

      @NotNull M bindTo(@NotNull @NotNull Class<? extends B> type) throws BindException
      Binds the mapper to the specified class type.

      Binding a class type allows the mapper to recognize and serialize instances of that type. This method may perform initialization or validation necessary for handling the specified type.

      Parameters:
      type - the Class object representing the type to bind to
      Returns:
      the current instance of M to allow method chaining
      Throws:
      BindException - if the binding process fails due to incompatible types or other issues
      NullPointerException - if type is null

    • unbind

      @NotNull M unbind(@NotNull @NotNull Class<? extends B> type) throws BindException
      Unbinds the mapper from the specified class type.

      Unbinding a class type removes the mapper's ability to recognize and serialize instances of that type. This can be useful for dynamically managing supported types at runtime.

      Parameters:
      type - the Class object representing the type to unbind from
      Returns:
      the current instance of M to allow method chaining
      Throws:
      BindException - if the unbinding process fails, for example, if the type was not previously bound
      NullPointerException - if type is null

    • bindTo

      @NotNull default @NotNull ReadingMapper<M,B> bindTo(@NotNull @NotNull Class<? extends B>[] types) throws BindException
      Binds the mapper to multiple class types provided as an array.

      This default method iterates over the array of class types and binds each one individually.

      Parameters:
      types - an array of Class objects representing the types to bind to
      Returns:
      the current instance of ReadingMapper<M, B> to allow method chaining
      Throws:
      BindException - if the binding process fails for any of the specified types
      NullPointerException - if types is null or contains null elements

    • bindTo

      @NotNull default @NotNull ReadingMapper<M,B> bindTo(@NotNull @NotNull Set<Class<? extends B>> types) throws BindException
      Binds the mapper to multiple class types provided as a Set.

      This default method iterates over the set of class types and binds each one individually.

      Parameters:
      types - a Set of Class objects representing the types to bind to
      Returns:
      the current instance of ReadingMapper<M, B> to allow method chaining
      Throws:
      BindException - if the binding process fails for any of the specified types
      NullPointerException - if types is null or contains null elements
